vocab_data.example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.
She is a gregarious person and enjoys attending social gatherings.
His laconic reply suggested he was displeased.
There were incipient signs of trouble between the two countries.

vocab_data.meaning: characterized by vulgar or excessive display; showy.
vocab_data.example: Her ostentatious jewelry drew unwanted attention.

vocab_data.meaning: lasting for a very short time.
vocab_data.example: The ephemeral nature of youth is often lamented.
His quixotic dreams of world peace seemed unattainable.
The proliferation of nuclear weapons is a serious global concern.

vocab_data.meaning: more important than anything else; supreme.
vocab_data.example: The safety of the passengers is of paramount importance.

vocab_data.meaning: understood by or intended for only a select few.
vocab_data.example: The professor's lecture on esoteric quantum physics left most students confused.

idioms_data.meaning: To start something, to initiate a process or project.
idioms_data.example: To get the ball rolling on the new marketing campaign, we need to finalize the budget first.

idioms_data.meaning: To face a difficult or unpleasant situation with courage and stoicism.
idioms_data.example: I didn't want to have the surgery, but I had to bite the bullet and go through with it.

idioms_data.meaning: Something that is very easy to do.
idioms_data.example: The exam was a piece of cake; I finished it in half the time.

idioms_data.meaning: A way of wishing someone good luck, especially before a performance.
idioms_data.example: Break a leg tonight, everyone! I know you'll do great.

idioms_data.meaning: To express something that has been bothering you; to confide in someone.
idioms_data.example: I needed to get it off my chest, so I finally told him how I felt.
